com.altimit_server.util

Class AltimitConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.altimit_server.util.AltimitConverter

  • public class AltimitConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts variables to and from byte array for sending or receiving method calls.

      • GetParameterClasses

        public static java.lang.Class[] GetParameterClasses(java.lang.Object[] parameters)
        Gets a list of class types of the paramaters provided
        Parameters:
        parameters - These are the parameters object versions of the variables.
        Returns:
        The class's of the valiables.

      • SendConversion

        public static byte[] SendConversion(java.lang.String methodName,
                                    java.lang.Object... args)
        Creates a byte array of the message that will be sent. The first 4 bytes is the end size of the whole message. The last 4 bytes is the message key used to identify the end of a message and later to be used for a security purpose.
        Parameters:
        methodName - Name of the method to be called on the client.
        args - These are the parameters that will be passed to the client.
        Returns:
        Byte array to be sent to sent to the client.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(char value)
        Converts Char into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Char value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 2 bytes of the Char.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(int value)
        Converts Int into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Int value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 4 bytes of the Int.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(long value)
        Converts Long into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Long value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 8 bytes of the Long.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(short value)
        Converts Short into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Short value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 2 bytes of the Short.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(float value)
        Converts Float into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Float value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 4 bytes of the Float.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(double value)
        Converts Double into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Double value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The rest are the 8 bytes of the Double.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(java.lang.String value)
        Converts String into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The String value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The next are the 4 bytes telling the size of the string as an int byte array. The rest is each character of the string in byte form.

      • convertToByteArray

        private static byte[] convertToByteArray(boolean value)
        Converts Boolean into byte array.
        Parameters:
        value - The Boolean value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Byte array of the value. 1st byte is the identifier. The next byte is 1 or 0 for true or false.

      • ReceiveConversion

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> ReceiveConversion(byte[] array)
        This is used to convert the byte array received from a client into the method name and parameters for a method call. The format is the same as the SendConversion method's output
        Parameters:
        array - The byte array to be converted
        Returns:
        An object array containing the method name and the parameters for said method.
